events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their car with another vehicle at a busy intersection resulting in damages to the front bumper and headlights.
The claim has been reviewed and categorised under the Auto Accident cluster due to keywords related to car collision and vehicle damage noted in the report.
A claims agent specializing in auto accidents has been assigned to the case to help guide the claimant through the process efficiently.
The claimant has been sent an official acknowledgment confirming receipt of their auto accident claim and outlining the next steps to take.
Requested supporting documents including police report, photos of vehicle damage, and repair estimates to proceed with the investigation.
Received all required documents from the claimant, including the official police report and detailed photos showing the extent of the vehicle damage.
The claims investigator has commenced a full review of the submitted materials alongside contacting involved parties for additional statements.
Investigation concluded with no discrepancies found; liability determined to be with the other driver involved in the accident.
A settlement offer has been prepared based on repair costs and damage assessment, aiming to cover the full expenses without further delay.
The claimant responded positively to the settlement proposal, expressing satisfaction with the prompt and fair handling of their claim.
The claim has been officially approved with all terms agreed upon by both parties, facilitating the next step of issuing payment.
Payment for the approved settlement amount has been processed and issued to the claimantâ€™s designated account.
The claim case has been formally closed following successful payment disbursement and claimant confirmation of receipt.
All documentation and claim files have been securely archived for future reference and compliance with regulatory requirements.
